title: heathcliff_(sao)
body:
A character in [[Sword Art Online]].  He is the founder and guild leader of the Knights of the Blood Oath (KoB) player guild. 

He's later revealed to be the in-game avatar of [spoiler]Game Master [[Kayaba Akihiko]][/spoiler].

title: kayaba_akihiko
body:
The main antagonist in the Aincrad arc of the [[Sword Art Online]] series, he is the development director and Game Master of the Sword Art Online fictional game as well as the designer of the [[NerveGear]].

[spoiler]He uses the [[Heathcliff (sao)|]] in-game avatar during the Aincrad arc, and has a supporting role during the Fairy Dance and Alicization arcs.[/spoiler]

title: ptrs-41
body:
The [b]PTRS-41[/b] is a gas-operated, semi-automatic [b][[anti-materiel rifle]][/b] of [[Soviet]] origin, chambered for the 14.5Ã—114mm [[rifle cartridge|cartridge]], designed by "Sergei Gavrilovich Simonov":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sergei_Gavrilovich_Simonov]. The [[weapon]] features a 5-round integral [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]]. It was used by the [[soviet army|Red Army]] during the [[World War II]], while the [[PTRD-41]] was more common due to lower cost and higher reliability compared to the PTRS-41.

h1. See also
* [[list of weapons]]
* [[SKS]]
* Wikipedia entry: "PTRS-41":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PTRS-41]

title: cetme_ameli
body:
The [b]CETME Ameli[/b] is a 5.56 mm NATO [b][[light machine gun]][/b] of Spanish origin, designed and developed in 1974 by "CETME":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CETME] research institute. Ameli is abbreviation of [i]Ametralladora ligera[/i], [[Spanish text|Spanish]] for light machine gun. The [[weapon]] was adopted by the Spanish Army in 1982  under the designation MG 82. It externally resembles the German [[MG3]]. 

h1. See also
* [[Ameli (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[list of weapons]]
* Wikipedia entry: "CETME Ameli":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CETME_Ameli

title: general_dynamics_lwmmg
body:
The Lightweight Medium Machine Gun (LWMMG) is an [[united states|American]] prototype belt-fed [b][[machine gun]][/b] which was first developed by General Dynamics. It is designed to fill the gap between 7.62 mm and .50 BMG machine guns. The weapon uses the .338 Norma Magnum, giving it greater range compared to 7.62 NATO [[rifle cartridge|round]]. 

h1. See also
* [[list of weapons]]
* [[LWMMG (Girls' Frontline)]]
* Wikipedia entry: "Lightweight Medium Machine Gun":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lightweight_Medium_Machine_Gun]

title: bee_gees
body: [b]The Bee Gees[/b] were a musical group formed in 1958 by brothers Barry, Robin, and Maurice Gibb. The trio were especially successful in popular music in the late 1960s and early 1970s, and later as prominent performers in the disco music era in the mid- to late 1970s.

title: hey_andy_sweetie_(meme)
body:
[b]Hey, Andy, Sweetie[/b] is a comic featuring a dialogue between the video game character [[Princess Peach]] and a young boy, in which Peach greets the boy by saying "Hey, Andy, sweetie." The comic has spawned numerous parodies and remixes on YouTube, Tumblr and DeviantArt.

h4. External links
* "Original video":[https://youtu.be/6zBTF4INW5g]
* "Hey Andy Sweetie on KnowYourMeme.com":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/hey-andy-sweetie]

title: bodice
body:
A close-fitting garment, often reinforced by stays, worn to support and shape the waistline, hips and breasts. A bodice is basically a [[corset]] that also covers the breasts.

Worn over the [[blouse]], the bodice is a common piece of women's traditional dress among many European ethnic groups.

title: bougu
body:
The [i]bougu[/i] (é˜²å…·) is a form of armor used in training and competition for [i]kendo[/i] and other Japanese weapons-based martial arts.  It's composed of four parts:

* [i]Men[/i] (é¢): Combined face mask & shoulder protection.
* [i][[Kote]][/i] (å°æ‰‹): Hand and forearm protection, usually with a mitten-like glove.
* [i][[Dou]][/i] (èƒ´): A breastplate for chest & stomach protection.
* [i]Tare[/i] (å‚): A belt of heavy cloth flaps to protect the groin and waist.  The center flap often has a place for the name of who the competitor is representing.

Practitioners of [i]naginatajutsu[/i] also wear:

* [i][[suneate|Sune-ate]][/i] (ã™ã­å½“ã¦):  Shin-guards.

h4.  See also

* [[List of armor]]
* Wikipedia (English):  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BÅgu.
* Wikipedia (Japanese):  http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/é˜²å…·_(å‰£é“).

title: remington_r5_rgp
body:
[b]R5 RGP[/b] (Remington Gas Piston) is a [[gun|carbine]] of [[united states|US]] origin, designed and manufactured by Remington Arms since 2010. It is an [[AR-15]] type [[rifle]] which uses a gas piston operating system in an attempt to improve the reliability. The RGP fires the 5.56mm NATO round from STANAG type [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]]s.

h1. See also
* [[list of weapons]]
* [[R5 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* "WeaponSystems.net":[https://weaponsystems.net/system/200-Remington+R5+RGP]

title: amakusa_shirou_tokisada_(samurai_spirits)
body:
[B]Amakusa Shiro Tokisada (å¤©è‰ å››éƒ æ™‚è²)[/b] is the main antagonist of the first [[Samurai Spirits]] game. He is based on the historical Amakusa, a Christian rebel who led a revolt that met an untimely defeat at Shimabara.

In Samurai Spirits, he is possessed by Ambrosia moments after the abovementioned event, dying, becoming an antagonist. After being defeated, his soul splits into two-- the evil Ambrosia-influenced side, later exterminated by the Kagama siblings Kazuki and Sogetsu, and his actual heroic and good side, who lives on to his originally good ways. It is this good side that saved [[Haoumaru]] and company in the events of the second Samurai Spirits game, before being defeated ultimately by Ambrosia.

His name is often misinterpreted; Shirou is his given name, while Amakusa is his surname or family name. Additionally, due to his clothes and sometimes voice, he is, in the past, mistaken for a female.

body:
An [[original|original character]] by [[Niliu Chahui]].

She is a [[demon girl]] who has [[blue eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] stylized in [[twin drills]] with [[bangs]], [[hair between eyes]] & [[sidelocks]]. Sometimes wears a [[red sweater|red]] [[off-shoulder sweater]].

She is often paired with [[Kurohanya (niliu chahui)|]].

title: misbegotten_crusader_(elden_ring)
body: The [b]Misbegotten Crusader[/b] boss in [[Elden Ring]]. He is a unique [[Leonine Misbegotten (elden ring)|]] found in the Cave of the Forlorn in the Consecrated Snowfields. He uses and drops the Golden Order Great Sword.

title: leonine_misbegotten_(elden_ring)
body: The [b]Leonine Misbegotten[/b] are great enemies and bosses in [[Elden Ring]]. As their names suggest, they are lion-like humanoids with a mangey red mane, stubby wings and a reptilian tail, similar to the other misbegotten enemies in the game, but much larger. They wield a great sword, and one in particular, the [[Misbegotten Crusader (elden ring)|]], carries the Golden Order Great sword.

title: sledgehammer
body:
A large [[hammer]] typically intended to be used with both hands that has a long shaft and a flat hammerhead, usually made of metal.   They're frequently used for demolition, and are sometimes equipment used by police for raids for forced entry onto properties.  They're also used in other applications, such as driving down railroad spikes or in shaping heavy slaps of iron.

Sledgehammers can distribute their force over a wider area, unlike most other hammers that concentrate their force to a relatively small area.  This makes them similar to [[mallet|mallets]].

title: sandevistan
body:
A cyberware implant in [i][[Cyberpunk 2077]][/i].

It's function is to give the user increased reflexes for higher reaction times. Gameplay-wise, it appears to the player as [[slow motion|slowing down time]].

title: peter_venkman
body: Peter Venkman, PhD is a fictional character from the [[Ghostbusters]] franchise. He appears in the films Ghostbusters, Ghostbusters II and Ghostbusters: Afterlife and in the animated television series The Real Ghostbusters. In all three live action films, he was portrayed by [[Bill Murray]], and was voiced in the animated series first by Lorenzo Music and then by Dave Coulier. He is a parapsychologist, initially a skeptic on the paranormal despite being a scientist of the subject, and the leader of the Ghostbusters.

title: robert_de_niro
body:
[b]Robert Anthony De Niro Jr.[/b] is an American actor, producer, and director. He is particularly known for his nine collaborations with filmmaker [[Martin Scorsese]], and is the recipient of various accolades, including two Academy Awards, a Golden Globe Award, the Cecil B. DeMille Award, and a Screen Actors Guild Life Achievement Award. In 2009, De Niro received the Kennedy Center Honor, and received a Presidential Medal of Freedom from U.S. President [[Barack Obama]] in 2016.

h1. Notable Roles
* [[Vito Corleone]] in [[The Godfather|The Godfather II]]
* [[Travis Bickle]] in [[Taxi Driver]]
* [[Murray Franklin]] in [[Joker (2019)]]

title: black_moon_lilith
body:
"In rabbinic literature Lilith is variously depicted as the mother of Adamâ€™s demonic offspring following his separation from Eve or as his first wife. Whereas Eve was created from Adamâ€™s rib (Genesis 2:22), some accounts hold that Lilith was the woman implied in Genesis 1:27 and was made from the same soil as Adam. Insolently refusing to be subservient to her husband, Lilith left Adam and the perfection of the Garden of Eden; three angels tried in vain to force her return. According to some mythologies, her demonic offspring were sired by an archangel named Samael and were not Adamâ€™s progeny."
https://www.britannica.com/topic/Lilith-Jewish-folklore

"Lilith represents something that has become unconscious and is striving to become conscious again. Letâ€™s call it archaic energy, spiritual femininity, something akin to the wisdom of the goddess. As long as we donâ€™t have access to this energy we experience it psychologically as loss, suppression, isolation, emptiness, addiction and above all power struggles."
-Hannelore Traugott

"Lilith is a fictitious second moon of Earth, supposedly about the same mass as the Earth's Moon, proposed in 1918 by astrologer Walter Gorn Old, who called himself Sepharial.

In present-day astrology, the name Black Moon Lilith is usually given to a point on the horoscope of the actual moon's apogee. When considered as a point, this Lilith is sometimes defined as the second focus of the ellipse described by the Moon's orbit; the earth is the first focus, and the apogee lies in the same direction. It takes 8 years and 10 months to complete its circuit around the zodiac."
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Planetary_objects_proposed_in_religion,_astrology,_ufology_and_pseudoscience#Lilith
https://www.astro.com/astrology/ivccn_article190722_e.htm

"The depiction of Lilith in Romanticism continues to be popular among Wiccans and in other modern Occultism. A few magical orders dedicated to the undercurrent of Lilith, featuring initiations specifically related to the arcana of the "first mother", exist."

"Gerald Gardner asserted that there was continuous historical worship of Lilith to present day, and that her name is sometimes given to the goddess being personified in the coven by the priestess. This idea was further attested by Doreen Valiente, who cited her as a presiding goddess of the Craft: "the personification of erotic dreams, the suppressed desire for delights".  In some contemporary concepts, Lilith is viewed as the embodiment of the Goddess, a designation that is thought to be shared with what these faiths believe to be her counterparts: Inanna, Ishtar, Asherah, Anath, Anahita and Isis.  According to one view, Lilith was originally a Sumerian, Babylonian, or Hebrew mother goddess of childbirth, children, women, and sexuality."

"Raymond Buckland holds that Lilith is a dark moon goddess on par with the Hindu Kali."

"Some Satanists believe that she is the wife of Satan and thus think of her as a mother figure. A different approach to a Satanic Lilith holds that she was once a fertility and agricultural goddess."

"The western mystery tradition associates Lilith with the Qliphoth of kabbalah. Dion Fortune writes, "The Virgin Mary is reflected in Lilith", and that Lilith is the source of "lustful dreams"."
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lilith#In_Western_esotericism_and_modern_occultism

"In the Babylonian and Hebrew lunisolar calendars, the years 3, 6, 8, 11, 14, 17, and 19 are the long (13-month) years of the Metonic cycle. This cycle forms the basis of the Greek and Hebrew calendars."
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metonic_cycle#Application_in_traditional_calendars

title: double_dealing_character
body:
æ±æ–¹è¼é‡åŸ ([i]Touhou Kishinjou[/i] - lit. "Eastern Castle of Shining Needles")

The fourteenth cardinal [[Touhou]] game, announced by [[ZUN]] on 11 May 2013.

It features the return of [[Izayoi Sakuya]] as a playable character, joining the usual protagonists [[Hakurei Reimu]] and [[Kirisame Marisa]].  The plot involves the three girls' trademark weapons all behaving oddly, as if they have minds of their own.  The game is, in ZUN's own words, "Neither novel or retro, an ageless neo-retro [[danmaku]] shooter."  

The three-level demo was released 26 May 2013 during [[Reitaisai]] 10.
Full version was released on 12 August 2013 during [[Comiket]] 84.

h4.Characters

h5.Playable
* [[Hakurei Reimu]]
* [[Kirisame Marisa]]
* [[Izayoi Sakuya]]

h5.Enemies
* Stage 1 Midboss: [[Cirno]]
* Stage 1 Boss: [[Wakasagihime]]
* Stage 2 Midboss/Boss: [[Sekibanki]]
* Stage 3 Midboss/Boss: [[Imaizumi Kagerou]]

* Stage 4 Midboss/Boss, Extra Stage Midboss: [[Tsukumo Yatsuhashi]]

title: mozambique_here_(meme)
body:
The phrase exclaimed by every character when pinging a [[SA-3 Mozambique]] in [[Apex Legends]]. The line became a meme due to how bad the weapon was at release, and players would often spam the ping to annoy squadmates.

Macros and parody images referencing the meme tend to feature [[Lifeline (apex legends)|]] primarily.

h4. See Also
* "Know Your Meme: Mozambique Shotgun":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/mozambique-shotgun]

title: childhood's_end
body:
[B]Childhood's End[/B] is a 1953 [[science fiction]] novel by [[United Kingdom|British]] author [[Arthur C. Clarke]]. 

The story follows the landing in Earth of mysterious advanced [[alien]]s, which causes several changes in human culture and human race as a whole. The book is notable because it deals with these issues with highly logical and scientific facts.

title: arthur_c._clarke
body:
[b]Sir Arthur Charles Clarke[/b] (16 December 1917 â€“ 19 March 2008) was a [[United Kingdom|British]] science fiction writer, [[scientist]], explorer, inventor and futurist. He is famous for his short stories and novels, including The Sentinel (1948), [[Childhood's End]] (1953), [[2001 A Space Odyssey]] (1968), Rendezvous with Rama (1972) and many others. Clarke's novels are notable for including several scientific facts and logical predictions that have proven true over the course of time and the advancements in technology. For many years [[Robert A. Heinlein]], [[Isaac Asimov]], and Clarke were known as the "Big Three" of science fiction literature.

Clarke also served in the Royal Air Force as a radar instructor and technician from 1941 to 1946. In 1945, he proposed a [[satellite]] communication system, an idea that, in 1963, won him the Franklin Institute's Stuart Ballantine Medal. He was the chairman of the British Interplanetary Society from 1947 to 1950 and again in 1953.

In 1956, Clarke emigrated to Sri Lanka, largely to pursue his interest in scuba diving. That year, he discovered the underwater ruins of the ancient Koneswaram temple in Trincomalee. He lived in Sri Lanka until his death. He was knighted by Queen Elizabeth II in 1998 and was awarded Sri Lanka's highest civil honour, Sri Lankabhimanya, in 2005.

title: england
body:
England is one of the four constituent countries of the [[United Kingdom]]. It shares land borders with [[Scotland]] to the north and [[Wales]] to the west; the Irish Sea is to the northwest, the Celtic Sea to the southwest, while the North Sea to the east and the English Channel to the south separate it from continental Europe. Most of England comprises the central and southern part of the island of Great Britain in the North Atlantic. The country also includes over 100 smaller islands such as the Isles of Scilly and the Isle of Wight.

Its capital city, [[London]], also serves as the capital of the United Kingdom as a whole. It served as the host of [[2012 Summer Olympics]].

h4. See also

* "Wikipedia: England":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/England

title: milburn
body:
A character from the 2012 [[science fiction]] horror film [[Prometheus (movie)|]]. He is played by English actor Rafe Spall.

[b]Milburn[/b] is a young [[scientist]] and biologist of [[United Kingdom|British]] ancestry. He wears [[glasses]].

title: centurion_(tank)
body:
The [b]Centurion[/b], introduced in 1945, was the primary [[United Kingdom|British]] main battle [[tank]] of the post-[[World War II]] period and the [[Cold War]]. It was created during WWII to counter heavy German tanks like the [[Tiger I]] and the [[Tiger II]]. However, it was deployed in the final days of the war in Europe and did not see any combat action.

It is widely considered to be one of the most successful post-war tank designs, remaining in production into the 1960s, and seeing combat in the front lines into the 1980s. The chassis was also adapted for several other roles, and these have remained in service to this day.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]
* [[Girls und Panzer]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Centurion":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Centurion_(tank)]

title: kundan_earrings
body: Kundan, meaning pure gold, is a traditional form of Indian gemstone jewellery involving a gem set with a gold foil between the stones and its mount, usually for elaborate necklaces and other jewellery.

title: aleister_crowley_(toaru_majutsu_no_index)
body:
The leader and founder of [[Academy City]] in [[Toaru Majutsu no Index]] and its spin-off [[Toaru Kagaku no Railgun]]. In the series, Aleister Crowley was the greatest magician to ever have lived but turned his back on magic to study science.  He is essentially the man behind the plot.

His namesake was an English occultist in the last 19th and early 20th century and one of the more well-known members of the Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn.  He is considered the coiner of the phrase "do as thou wilt shall be the whole of the law," which is paraphrased from his book [i]Liber AL vel Legis[/i].  His syncretism of Hermeticism, yoga and other Eastern spiritualism, and Egyptian mythology combined with his prolific writing has made him hugely influential in modern occult and neo-pagan movements.

h4. External links

* "Toaru Majutsu no Index Wiki: Aleister Crowley":http://toarumajutsunoindex.wikia.com/wiki/Aleister_Crowley

title: snow_white
body:
Folk tale of a young princess who was nearly murdered by her queen mother by a [[bad food|poisoned red apple]] and ends up in the forest living with dwarfs. The most well known incarnation of the character comes from the 1937 [[Disney]] animated film [[Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs]].

title: comic_aun
body:
A monthly Japanese [[magazine (object)|]]. [[Magazine cover]]s illustrated by [[Misaki Kurehito]]. Noteworthy for having some recurring characters, some of which have been given names and adapted into figurines.

h4. Characters

* [[Amami Anzu]]

title: cat_paws
body:
A human, humanoid, kemonomimi character with cat paws for hands, or cat-themed [[paw gloves]]. Not to be used for paws of actual cats.

For posing the hands like a cat, see [[paw pose]].

h4. See also

* [[animal hands]]

title: chiaroscuro
body:
[i]Chiaroscuro[/i] is a term from art theory referring to the use of strong contrasts between light and dark across an entire composition to achieve a sense of volume in modeling three-dimensional objects. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Chiaroscuro":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chiaroscuro]

h4. See also

* [[tenebrism]]

title: moon_rabbit
body:
Folktale about a [[rabbit]] on the [[moon]] pounding [[mochi]].

In Japanese culture, instead of seeing "the man on the moon" it is said that there is a rabbit pounding [[mochi]]. In Chinese folktale, "Jade rabbit" makes the elixir of immortality on the moon.

h4. See also

* [[moon]]
* [[mochi]]
* [[mallet]]
* [[mortar (bowl)|]]
* [[mochitsuki]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Moon rabbit":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moon_rabbit

title: takeya_yuki
body:
The main heroine of [[Gakkou Gurashi!]].  A bright and cheerful teen who really loves her school and club. She has [[short_hair|short]] [[pink hair]], and typically wears a [[school uniform]] with an [[animal hat]] and [[winged bag]]. Several [[hairclip]]s adorn her hair, with one of them having a teddy bear's face on it.

[spoiler]Revealed at the start that she's suffering from psychosis and still views the world as it was before the zombie outbreak.[/spoiler]

title: looking_at_food
body: When a person looks at [[food]].

title: q.e.d.
body:
Q.E.D. è¨¼æ˜çµ‚äº† (Q.E.D. Shomei Shuuryou) is a detective manga by Motohiro Katou. The main character Sou Touma encounters a variety of mystery cases. Sou often works in tandem with his friend and potential love interest Kana, with him supplying the brain while she acts as brawn.

In 2009, the manga won the Kodansha Manga Award for the shÅnen category, sold over a total of 3 millions copies and adapted as a live-action TV series.

h4. Characters

title: makami_hare
body:
A Japanese [[Virtual YouTuber]], a [[rabbit girl]] with [[white hair]] and [[red eyes]]. Character design by [[Ixy]].
She debuted on [[Seven Carat]] on August 20, 2021, but graduated on March 31, 2022. After a short hiatus, she returned as an [[indie_virtual_youtuber|indie]] on May 6, 2022.

title: ebisu_eika
body: Stillborn Idol of the Riverbed The first stage boss of [[Touhou]] 17: [[Wily Beast and Weakest Creature]]. She is a stillborn infant's spirit who has become a god of fortune and is the leader of other stillborn spirits. Her ability is to stack and balance [[stone|stones]] well, and she can also turn other otherwise mundane tasks into fun. She has [[grey hair]] and [[long earlobes]]. She has a matching [[skirt set]] resembling a jellyfish, and is [[barefoot|barefooted]]. Notably, she is one of the few characters in the series without a hat or head ornament. h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki: Eika Ebisu":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Eika_Ebisu

title: seesaw
body:
A board mounted on a fixed center pivot, used as [[playground]] equipment. One person sits on each end so that they can take turns pushing off the ground and rising into the air.

h4.External links

title: tang_wutong_(douluo_dalu)
body:
She is the daughter of [[Tang San]], and [[Xiao Wu (douluo dalu)|]] from [[Douluo Dalu]]. She the Heroine of Douluo Dalu, and the wife Huo Yuhao from Douluo Dalu 2. She takes the form of Wang Dong early in the story as she disguises as a male while she was young, and ultimately reveals her true form when they're older. She also has a Soul Fusion with Huyao where takes the form of the Goddess of Life who looks like a more mature version of Tang Wutong in white clothes.

Associated:
[[Wang Qiu er (douluo dalu)|]], She has a similar appearance as Tang Wutong as well having the powerful Golden Dragon Martial Soul granting her immense strength. She was also mistaken as a doppelganger, or a sibling do to the very close resemblance to her. Her true form is a Three Eyed Golden Lion who has traces of the Golden Dragon Bloodline, but is simulated by the God King, Tang San. She was created as a test by Tang San for Hu Yao's love for Tang Wutong.

title: gsh-18
body:
The [b]GSh-18[/b] is a Russian semi-automatic [b][[handgun|pistol]][/b] developed by "KBP Instrument Design Bureau":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/KBP_Instrument_Design_Bureau] in the late 1990s. The pistol's name is derived from the initials of its designers, Gryazev and Shipunov, as well as the its standard [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] capacity of 18 rounds. 

The GSh-18 is a rotating-barrel, short-recoil, locked-breech pistol with 10 locking lugs spaced equally around the barrel. These lugs provide a large locking surface area, resulting in a strong lockup. While the GSh-18 can use standard 9Ã—19mm Parabellum rounds, it was designed to use the higher-velocity, Russian [[body armor|armour]]-piercing 7N31 9Ã—19mm [[ammunition|round]]. The pistol incorporates a pre-set striker, in a similar manner to the [[Glock]]. The frame is made of polymer. The GSh-18 pistol is of incredibly simple design and construction, containing only 17 total parts. 

h1. See also
* [[GSh-18 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[list of weapons]]
* Wikipedia entry: "GSh-18":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GSh-18]

General tag applicable to detailed depictions of heavy mechanical equipment (such as vehicle, mecha, etc.) that is given visual emphasis in the picture. 

Also a commonly used term for the armaments (aka [[rigging]]) worn by shipgirls and enemies in [[Kantai Collection]] and [[Azur Lane]].

Not to be confused with [[machine]] tag, which refers to various other generic machinery.

title: sbd_dauntless
body:
The Douglas SBD Dauntless was a World War II American naval scout plane and dive bomber. It was similar to the Aichi [[D3A]] but with greater bomb load and armor protection.

Generally rugged and reliable, it served alongside the [[TBF Avenger]] as the backbone of the American fleet air arm. The plane is best kown for sinking the four Japanese aircraft carriers at the [[Battle of Midway]].

The aircraft was designed by Ed Heinemann who would subsequently design the [[A-1 Skyraider]] and the [[A-4 Skyhawk]].

h4.See also

* [[List of Airplanes]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Douglas SBD Dauntless":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Douglas_SBD_Dauntless

title: rex_zero_1_(late_night_tea)_(girls'_frontline)
body:
[[Rex Zero 1 (girls' frontline)|]]'s second skin from [[Girls' Frontline]], as part of the 'Workplace Evolution' skin collection from 2022.

A [[business casual]] [[office lady]] attire. While elements such as her hat are discarded, others such as her [[black choker|black]] [[choker]] and [[necklace]] remain, further bolstered by new additions such as the [[dice hair ornament]] which adorn her [[low twintails]] and [[braid]], and her [[black-framed eyewear|black-framed]] [[glasses]]. For the core of her attire, she wears an [[bra peek|half]]-[[cleavage|unbuttoned]] [[red shirt]] with a [[lanyard]]ed [[ID card]], with a [[black jacket]] on [[jacket on shoulders|her shoulders]] (within which one can see her namesake handgun), along with an [[asymmetrical skirt|asymmetrical]] [[black skirt|black]] [[skirt suit|skirt]], covering far less of her left leg, highlighting her [[black pantyhose|black]] [[pantyhose]]. With a few ornaments on her skirt and jacket, she tops this off with a pair of [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]]. With her, she carries two [[clipboard]]s under her shoulder, and two [[mug]]s filled with the skin's titular tea, freshly-brewed. Her damaged art has her having spilled the clipboards onto the floor, and dumping [[sugar cube]]s into her tea, as her shirt becomes unbuttoned and her [[blue bra]] becomes visible.

title: naca_duct
body:
An "NACA duct":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NACA_duct] is a distinctive style of low-drag air intake. It takes its name from the National Advisory Committee for Aeronautics, a U.S. government agency founded in 1915 to... well... advise on aeronautics. (NACA evolved into NASA, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration, in 1958.) Although originally developed for aircraft, NACA ducts have appeared on a number of automobiles and motorcycles designed in the 1970s and 1980s. Notable examples of NACA-duct-equipped cars include the [[Ferrari F40]] and [[Lamborghini Countach]]. Some of these ducts were functional air intakes, but others were merely cosmetic--meant to convey an impression that the vehicles were high-tech and high-performance, like jet aircraft.

As an aside, "NACA" is an initialism, not an acronym (that is, the letters are pronounced individually, not as a single word).

title: chall_acustica
body:
Main protagonist of [[Gundam 00P]]'s first season.

She was a Second Generation Gundam Meister and designated pilot of the [[Gundam Plutone]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]], [[brown hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. [spoilers]However, due to a catastrophic tragedy which involves the Gundam Plutone and claimed the lives of her fellow Meisters, [[Ruido Resonance]] and [[Marlene Vlady]], Chall's hair turned [[white hair|white]], and she gained a huge [[scar]] on her left body and left eye. She retained her new appearance when she returns in 00P second season and its sequel, [[Gundam 00F]]. [/spoilers]

She's voiced by [[Aida Rikako]] [spoilers](00P version) and [[Kaida Yuuko]] (00F version)[/spoilers] in [[SD Gundam G-Generation|SD Gundam G-Generation Cross Rays]].

title: ecole_du_ciel
body:
A spinoff [[Gundam]] manga set in the Universal Century timeline, taking place before and during the events of [[Zeta Gundam]]. 

It is written and illustrated by [[Mikimoto Haruhiko]].

It is one of the earliest Gundam entries to feature a female protagonist.

title: asuna_elmarit
body:
The main protagonist of spinoff [[Gundam]] manga [[Ecole du Ciel]]. She is also one of the franchise's earliest female protagonists.

Asuna Elmarit is a student from Ã‰cole du Ciel, a military school for training future mobile suits pilots in MontrÃ©al, Canada. Unexpected events occur, exposing Asuna and her classmates to the reality that is war.

She pilots several types of mobile suits, including the [[Le Cygne]], a Gundam which became her signature mobile suit. 

Her character design resembles that of [[Takaya Noriko]] from [[Top wo Nerae!]], which also has [[Mikimoto Haruhiko]] as character designer.

title: leorio_paladiknight
body:
One of the four main characters of [[Hunter x Hunter]].

Leorio is initially introduced as a very selfish narcissist who places great emphasis on material wealth. Despite his assertions that he is only after money, he eventually reveals to [[Kurapika]] that he lost a close friend to a debilitating illness and this inspired him to become a doctor and earn money in order to help the sick and poor. He believes that all things in the world (lives, dreams, etc.) can be bought and that becoming a Hunter will provide him with the necessary funds for his medical education. In the Hunter Exam, Leorio meets [[gon_freecss|Gon]], [[killua_zoldyck|Killua]] and [[Kurapika]], the other three main characters of the series.

h4. Appearance

Leorio is a tall, manly-looking, fairly [[toned]] young man with small [[brown eyes]], [[black hair]], and a [[spiked_hair|spiked]] crew cut. He typically wears a dark blue [[business suit]], [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]], and teashade [[glasses]].

Some of the characters such as Killua near at the beginning of the story mistake Leorio for an old man, but he is actually a lot younger than he looks, being a teenager at the start of the series.

h4. Voice actors

* [[Nobutoshi Canna]] (Pilot OVA)
* [[Gouda Hozumi]] (1999)
* [[Fujiwara Keiji]] (2011)
* [[Jonathan Love]] (1999, EN)
* [[Matthew Mercer]] (2011, EN)

h4. External links

* "Hunterpedia: Leorio Paradinight":http://hunterxhunter.wikia.com/wiki/Leorio_Paradinight

title: kamen_victory
body:
A supporting character in the [[kamen america (comic)|Kamen America]] comic series and the fourth member of the Kamen Corps. Her real name is Sylvia Prestige. Her family owns an international outdoor shop, and she has been [[kamen america|Carly's]] rival since elementary school. This rivalry continued when Carly's old media relations company chose Sylvia to be Kamen U.N. after Carly cut ties with them. After settling their differences [spoilers]and the revelation that the Kamen U.N. armor was a fake made by [[Vermillion Masquerade]][/spoilers], Sylvia joined the Kamen Corps. Unlike the rest of the Kamen Corps, Sylvia does not have any powers since she was not struck by space debris. However, she can control a special-made armor created from chimeraton-imbued materials [spoilers]due to second-hand exposure to chimeratons in Vermillion Masquerade's mud[/spoilers]. Sylvia is motivated by a desire to help people. She is secretly an avid gamer.

Sylvia has [[purple eyes]] and long, platinum [[blonde hair]]. She usually wears a [[black hairband]] which she replaces with a [[red hairband]] when wearing her Kamen Victory armor.

title: your_present_is_me
body: When a character presents themself to another as a [[gift]], usually on a traditional gift-giving occasion (e.g., Christmas, Valentine's Day, or the receiving character's birthday). Often involves [[naked ribbon]] and/or the presented character being [[in box|in a box]]. Valentine's Day versions also tend to involve [[chocolate on body]]. The receiving character doesn't necessarily need to be shown, and if shown, may or may not be pleased.

title: ranni_the_witch
body:
[b]Ranni the Witch[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. She is a mysterious figure who first introduces herself as Renna. Upon meeting her again, she reveals her true name and recruits the [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] in servitude, setting them off in search of a hidden treasure. Her other servants are [[Blaidd the Half-Wolf]], [[War Counselor Iji]], [[Preceptor Seluvis]], and [[Glintstone Dragon Adula]]. She is the [[family|daughter]] of [[rennala queen of the full moon|Rennala]] and [[radagon of the golden order|Radagon]].

Ranni wears a [[large hat|large]] [[witch hat]] with wiry, silver [[hat ornament|ornamentation]] resembling a [[wreath]], and a [[fur cloak]] or [[fur cape|cape]] over what appears to be a pale [[robe]] or [[dress]]. She has [[extra arms|four arms]] and her limbs are [[doll joints|visibly jointed]]. She has [[cracked_skin|cracks]] on the left side of her face. She also has a second, translucent [[extra faces|face]] (called her "spirit face") which is displaced to one side, such that its left eye overlaps with her physical face's right eye. It is rather subtle and many players and artists don't notice it at first.

She normally wears a plain, silver [[ring]] on the ring finger of one of her right hands.

h4. See also

* [[Miniature Ranni]]
* [spoilers][[Lunar Princess Ranni]][/spoilers]

title: mid-autumn_festival
body:
The Mid-Autumn Festival (simplified Chinese: ä¸­ç§‹èŠ‚; traditional Chinese: ä¸­ç§‹ç¯€), also known as Moon Festival or Mooncake Festival, is a traditional Chinese festival celebrated by China and many East and Southeast Asian people under the influence of China. It is the second-most important holiday after Chinese New Year with a history dating back over 3,000 years, when the Emperor of China worshipped the moon for bountiful harvests.

h4. See also

title: ichigo_hitofuri
body:
A [[Touken Ranbu]] character, designed by [[Kanameyura]]. The personification of the [[tachi (weapon)|tachi]] "[i]Ichigo Hitofuri[/i]":http://meitou.info/index.php/ä¸€æœŸä¸€æŒ¯. He is the older brother of the Awataguchi school swords, due to the fact that he was the only tachi ever forged by Awataguchi.

Originally named "Okatana Yoshimitsu" (å¾¡åˆ€å‰å…‰), Ichigo Hitofuri once belonged to Toyotomi Hideyoshi. He ordered the blade to be shortened to match his rather short height. Ichigo Hitofuri was damaged in the summer of 1615 during the Siege of Osaka at Osaka Castle and then re-tempered by Yasutsugu under the order of Tokugawa Ieyasu. However, Ieyasu didnâ€™t had the chance to use this sword because he was advised by the Priest Tenkai to avoid sending Hideyoshiâ€™s swords (including Ichigo Hitofuri) to Edo. It has been an Imperial treasure since that time, alongside [[Tsurumaru Kuninaga]], [[Uguisumaru]] and [[Hirano Toushirou]].

He has [[short hair|short]] [[aqua hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. He wears [[white gloves]] and a [[military uniform]] with [[necktie]].

Ichigo has a polite and humble personality and is shown to be concerned with his brothers' well-being. However, it seems that he keeps things to himself, such as the fact that he's worried about losing his identity (since he was retempered in the past) and is secretly displeased about the Saniwa having so many swords. 

Fans enjoy portraying him as the big brother of the Awataguchi tantous, due to him being the biggest/tallest blade among Yoshimitsu's creations, not because he's the oldest among them. Either that, or he's presented as a foil to the prankster Tsurumaru.

Because of his in-game elder brother status, many of the swords tend to call him "Ichi-nii" (Big brother Ichi), which extends to his nickname outside the game as well.

title: shinano_toushirou
body:
A [[Touken Ranbu]] character. The personification of the [[tantou]] "Shinano Toushirou" and one of the many tantous of the Awataguchi school swords.

He was named after its owner Nagai Naomasa, whose title was Shinano no Kami, one of Tokugawa Ieyasu's retainers. Before that, it was owned by Toyotomi Hideyoshi.

He has short [[red hair]] and [[green eyes]]. He wears [[black gloves]] and a [[military uniform]] with [[necktie]], [[shorts]] and [[thigh holster|thigh holsters]].

A haughty and spoiled child, Shinano prides himself of being a "treasured sword" and thinks himself to be superior to the rest of the Toushirou brothers. He often demands for the [[saniwa_(touken_ranbu)|Saniwa]]'s attention, asking for attention and/or physical contact. His catchphrase is "æ‡å…¥ã£ã¦ã„ã„ï¼Ÿ ([[futokoro haitte ii?|Can I stay close to you?]])". Because it literally has the meaning of "Can I be in your bosom?", it is sometimes jokingly referred to as a sexually suggestive phrase.

After his Kiwame remodel, [spoiler]he isn't recognized by his former masters, but gets to reunite with the Sakai clan again. It helps Shinano realize, however, that he took the kindness of his current family and Saniwa for granted. When he returns, he's still as spoiled and clingy as before, but he stops acting like an entitled kid.[/spoiler]

Voiced by [[Kobayashi Yuusuke]]. Artist is [[Kunimitsu (9nimi2)|]].

title: surprised_pikachu_(meme)
body:
[b]Surprised Pikachu[/b], also known as Shocked Pikachu, refers to a screenshot from the [[Pokemon_(anime)|PokÃ©mon]] anime of the character [[Pikachu]] with its mouth agape, as though it were surprised at something. In the autumn of 2018, the image was used as a reaction image paired with captions where a set-up leads to a predictable outcome that nevertheless leaves one surprised.

Surprised Pikachu automatically gives an example of :o

h4. See also
* "Surprised Pikachu on KnowYourMeme.com":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/surprised-pikachu]

title: girls_gone_wild
body: [b]Girls Gone Wild[/b] was an adult entertainment franchise that mostly featured college aged girls being filmed going wild during parties like getting drunk, exposing themselves or kissing each other. The series ended in 2011 due to increasing negative reception of sexism and sexual exploitation when it was revealed several girls featured were underage or forced by the producers to act wild.

body: A [[card]] that is yellow in color. Mainly used in [[soccer]] to indicate that a player has done a minor foul and thus still be able to play for the rest of the game. title: vorago
body:
Gigantic, rocky group boss monster in [i][[RuneScape]][/i]. Its name comes from the Latin word for "abyss". It's actually friendly, but can be challenged to an extremely difficult fight.

He is immortal and can only be stopped by a hammer forged from the weapon fragments embedded in him (wielded by [[hakurei reimu|Reimu]] in post #2287712. But even if defeated this way, he will still reform.

h4. See also

* [[Mega Man (character)|]], also called Rockman (in Japan)

h4. External links

* "RuneScape Wiki":[https://runescape.wiki/w/Vorago]

title: p-40_warhawk
body:
Built by Curtiss and flown by every Allied country with an air force, the [b]P-40 Warhawk[/b] is one of the most iconic and influential American aircraft ever produced, for both engineering and cultural reasons.

Despite being inferior in speed and altitude performance to most frontline aircraft when the United States entered [[WWII]], the P-40 was famous for punching above its weight. The P-40 was tough, easy to fly and could outdive fighters six years newer and fifteen thousand dollars more expensive - strengths that were exploited by the famous "Flying Tigers", who exclusively flew P-40s. 

But much more importantly the P-40 was culturally influential. Those Flying Tigers became an important propaganda tool for the United States, and the shark-teeth warpaint that adorned their P-40s had been copied an innumerable amount of times on any aircraft on any country- including, ironically, Japan.

title: j7w_shinden
body:
The [b]Kyushu J7W Shinden[/b] (éœ‡é›», "Magnificent Lightning") was a land-based interceptor developed during [[World War II]] by the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] to defend against bombing raids by the [[B-29 Superfortress]]. 

h4. Appearance
[tn]See post #990309.[/tn]

Only two prototypes were built and the first flight was not until August 3, 1945, less than two weeks before the Japanese surrender. One of the the prototypes was scrapped after the war and the other is preserved in the Smithsonian's National Air and Space Museum.

Despite having played no role in the war, the Shinden's distinctive appearance (with a rear-mounted "pusher" propeller, rear-mounted wings and [[canards]]) and the fact that it was Imperial Japan's most technologically advanced piston aircraft have given it an enduring popularity.

h4. See also
* [[List of airplanes]]
* "Wikipedia: Kyushu J7W":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyushu_J7W_Shinden]
* Kancolle Wiki: "Shinden (Magnificent Lightning) Kai":http://kancolle.wikia.com/wiki/Shinden_%28Magnificent_Lightning%29_Kai (a fictional carrier-based variant)
** [[Shinden (Kancolle)]] (its [[fairy (kancolle)|]] pilot)

body: Cheongsachorong are Korean traditional [[lantern]]s, originally used for weddings in Korea. They are made by rounded or square wood or steel form, covered by red and blue color of silk shades with hanging candle inside the body.

title: libyan_guitar_hero_(meme)
body: A [[meme]] originated from a photograph during the [[Libyan civil war]], involving a group of anti-[[muammar_gaddafi|Gaddafi]] forces taking cover from enemy fire while the lone [[guitar]]ist playing his instrument and singing next to them.

title: gaybar_pose_(meme)
body:
Famous attack move done by [[Danny Lee]] in original [[Gachimuchi]] videos. In this scene, Danny grabs both of [[Billy Herrington]]'s arms, pressing one of his knees on Billy's back, stretching his arms and shouts [b]"Give up!"[/b], which was widely misheard as "Gaybar".

This pose went viral in Japanese communities along with Gachimuchi communities which later spread outside Japan.

title: hizamaru_(touken_ranbu)
body:
Personification of the [[tachi (weapon)|tachi]] ''Usu-midori'', treasure of the Minamoto Clan. The name used for [i][[Touken Ranbu]][/i] is one of many that the sword had obtained over the years, ''Hizamaru'' in particular referencing a practice test where the sword cut through the knees of an opponent. 

The game portrays him as the younger brother/ younger brother figure of fellow Minamoto clan sword [[higekiri_(touken_ranbu)|Higekiri]], and is highly affectionate towards him though the historical Higekiri was used to cut Usu-midori (thus earning the name ''Tomokiri'', "Friend Cutter"). This is because of the relationship between their owners; Hizamaru's owner Minamoto no Yoshitsune had his brother Yoritomo, owner of Higekiri, in high regard. He also frets about becoming "separated" from his brother again, as seen in his citadel, pre-battle quote and sword breaking dialogue.

Has [[green hair]] swept over [[hair_over_one_eye| to the right side]] and [[yellow eyes]], and wears a [[military uniform]] with [[black gloves]]. He also has rather prominent [[fangs]] when he opens his mouth.


Shares a character designer with Higekiri in [[shirano]].

title: higekiri_(touken_ranbu)
body:
A [[tachi (weapon)|Tachi-class sword]]. Treasure of the Minamoto/Genji Clan, obtaining its name from a  test beheading where the sword cleanly cut through a criminal's beard along with the neck. Currently stored in Kitano Tenmangu Temple in Kyoto. 

In [i][[Touken Ranbu]][/i], the sword is treated as the elder brother of [[hizamaru_(touken_ranbu)|Hizamaru]], another Minamoto clan Sword, though he's constantly forgetting Hizamaru's name. This may be a reference to the fact that both Hizamaru and Higekiri have had many different names throughout history. Fan works like to exaggerate this trait to the point of being a running gag, as Higekiri is bad with other names, as well.

He's portrayed with [[short_hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with [[yellow eyes]], and wears a white jacket [[jacket_on_shoulders|around his shoulders]]. Has black [[half gloves]].

[i]Seiyuu[/i] is [[Hanae Natsuki]]. Character designer is [[shirano]].

These extensions feature dark green spiky arrangements at the base, yellow spikes further up, and flowers, with pink petals and yellow centers, at the top. body:
[b]Bob Norman Ross[/b] (October 29, 1942 â€“ July 4, 1995) was an American painter and television host who died of lymphoma at the age of 52.

title: steve_irwin
body:
[b]Stephen Robert Irwin[/b] (22 February 1962 â€“ 4 September 2006), nicknamed the "Crocodile Hunter" was an Australian zookeeper and television personality.

Irwin became prominent as the titular host of the 1996 wildlife television series "[i]The Crocodile Hunter[/i]."

Irwin died in Batt Reef on September 2006 after being repeatedly stabbed by a [[stingray|smooth stingray]] in the chest, resulting in his heart being pierced by the stingray's barb. Irwin was supposed to be filming for his final documentary [i]Ocean's Deadliest[/i].

h4.External links
"Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steve_Irwin]

title: sea_bream
body:
A species of [[fish]] with a "round-ish" body shape from the family [b]Sparidae[/b].

It is the most commonly eaten fish in Taiwan.

It is eaten on New Years Eve or festive occasions in Japan.

title: anglerfish
body:

Well known types of anglerfishes include the deep sea anglerfish, the frogfish, and the sea toad.

title: roland_tr-808
body: The [b]Roland TR-808 Rhythm Composer[/b] is an analog synthesis [[drum machine]] manufactured by Roland Corporation. Though only in production from 1980 to 1983 an considered a commercial failure by its manufacturer, the TR-808 achieved a cult following and became the iconic drum machine of the later 1980s and beyond, particularly in the electronica and hip-hop genres.

title: gee_bill!_(meme)
body:
Parody images of the [i]Skinless[/i] hotdogs advertisement, published in September of 1942 from [i]Woman's Day[/i] magazine.

Depicts two characters, one with one thing, and the other with two of that thing. The former asking the latter something similar to "Gee [x]! How come [y] lets you have [u]two[/u] [z]s?"

h4. Know Your Meme entry
* https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/gee-bill-how-come-your-mom-lets-you-eat-two-wieners

title: futaba_sana_(roomwear_costume)
body:
An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Futaba Sana]] in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]]. Originally designed for a pop-up store in Tokyo Anime Center and released on merchandise in February 2022, though it was adapted into a in-game costume one year later.

Sana's [[medium hair|medium]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[aqua hair]] is tied into [[twintails]] with [[hair beads|beads]] and decorated with a [[Kyubey]]-[[objectification|themed]] [[sleep mask]]. She also has [[blunt bangs|blunt]] [[bangs]], [[sidelocks]] and [[green eyes]]. 

She wears a [[short dress|short]] [[green dress|green]] [[dress]] with [[vertical-striped dress|vertical stripes]], [[buttons]], [[short sleeves]] and a [[wing collar|wing]] [[collared dress|collar]], a [[ring]], a [[white jacket|white]] [[off shoulder|off-shoulder]] [[jacket]] with [[pockets]], [[yellow_leg_warmers|yellow]] [[leg warmers]] with a [[floral print|floral]] [[print leg warmers|print]] and [[green footwear|green]] [[slippers]].

title: survivor_(stand)
body:
A [[stand (jojo)|stand]] in [[Stone Ocean]]. Described as the weakest Stand by [[dio brando|DIO]], with its sole ability being to transfer small electric shocks to people in order to make them irrationally angry.

Two possible namesakes are American rock band Survivor (active 1978-1988, 1993-present) and their eponymous debut studio album, released in February 1980.

title: diablo_(isekai_maou)
body:
The main protagonist of [i][[Isekai Maou to Shoukan Shoujo no Dorei Majutsu]][/i].

In his previous life, he is known as [b]Takuma Sakamoto[/b], also known by his username of "[nodtext]@Diablo-13[/nodtext]". Later on, Takuma became the very character he was playing in an MMORPG named "Cross Reverie" after reincarnating in the video game's world.

Portrayed as a highly confident, insolent demon lord with charismatic aura, but in truth, is an introvert and rather nervous man.

title: ump45_(winter_journey)_(girls'_frontline)
body:
A skin for [[UMP45 (girls' frontline)|]] from [[Girls' Frontline]], available only to those who purchased the same jacket from the official shop and redeemed the special code that came with it, thusly exclusive to the older servers (one of a select few to be such).

title: shaohua_hatsune_miku
body:

title: 9a-91_(a_loyal_friend's_company)_(girls'_frontline)
body:
[[9A-91 (girls' frontline)|]]'s third skin from [[Girls' Frontline]], as part of the early fall 2021 'Urban Beasties Rhapsody' skin collection, being given away for free as part of the 'Together With Me' key card event.

As per the other skins in the collection, 9A-91 has [[furry female|undergone]] [[furrification]], becoming a [[white fur|white]] [[fox ears|fox]].
